review_method: Comprehensive syntax comparison between SKILL.md and actual jira-as time CLI commands

findings.actual: jira-as time log does NOT support --reduce-by option
findings.issue: Example shows --reduce-by being used with 'log' command, but the actual jira-as time log CLI help shows no --reduce-by option. The log command only supports: -t/--time, -c/--comment, -s/--started, -a/--adjust-estimate [auto|leave|new|manual], --new-estimate, --visibility-type, --visibility-value
findings.impact: Users copying this example will get an error: 'no such option: --reduce-by'
findings.fix: Remove this example or replace with: jira-as time log PROJ-123 -t 2h --adjust-estimate auto

findings.issue: Options table for 'worklogs' command is incomplete
findings.impact: Documentation suggests worklogs only has output option, but users can't discover filtering capabilities documented in examples
findings.fix: Update table at line 79-83 to show all available worklogs options including filters

findings.actual: jira-as time delete-worklog requires -n flag: jira-as time delete-worklog PROJ-123 -w 12345 -n
findings.issue: Example uses --dry-run (long form) but actual CLI help shows -n/--dry-run. While --dry-run works, it's inconsistent with other examples that use short form
findings.impact: Inconsistent style in documentation. Other examples correctly use -n
findings.fix: Change line 290 from '--dry-run' to '-n' for consistency

findings.issue: Example uses --yes (long form) when convention in documentation is short forms. Other similar skip/confirm flags use short forms

findings.documented: jira-as time report -p PROJ -s 2025-01-01 --until 2025-01-31 -f csv > timesheet.csv
findings.issue: Documentation uses -f for format in report command, but Common Options table (line 82) states -f/--format only for export. In report command, CLI actually shows -f/--format [text|csv|json], so it IS available but table is unclear about which commands support -f
findings.impact: Common Options table is misleading about -f availability across commands
findings.fix: Clarify in Common Options table which commands support which output/format flags

findings.documented: --period PERIOD: Time period: today, yesterday, this-week, last-week, this-month, last-month, or YYYY-MM format
findings.actual: --period TEXT: Predefined time period (or YYYY-MM format)
findings.issue: Documentation correctly mentions YYYY-MM format at line 104, but export command documentation at line 111-116 does NOT explicitly mention YYYY-MM format for export --period
findings.impact: Users reading export options may not realize they can use YYYY-MM format
findings.fix: Add explicit mention of YYYY-MM format to export --period documentation

findings.issue: Example uses long-form --author but other examples consistently use short-form flags. This is technically correct but violates consistency pattern
findings.fix: Update to: jira-as time worklogs PROJ-123 -a currentUser()

findings.actual: Options are -s/--since and -u/--until (convention is short form)
findings.issue: Example uses long-form flags while other examples use short form
findings.fix: Update to: jira-as time worklogs PROJ-123 -s 2025-01-01 -u 2025-01-31

findings.documented: --increase-by TIME: Amount to increase estimate (for adjust=manual with delete)
findings.issue: Table shows --increase-by is available for log command, but actual CLI only supports it for delete-worklog command
findings.impact: Users may try to use --increase-by with log or update-worklog and fail
findings.fix: Move --increase-by documentation to delete-worklog specific section only

findings.documented: --reduce-by TIME: Amount to reduce estimate (for adjust=manual with log)
findings.actual: --reduce-by is NOT supported by log command at all
findings.issue: Documentation suggests --reduce-by can be used with log command when adjust=manual, but actual CLI doesn't support this option for log
findings.impact: Example on line 155 based on this documentation will fail
findings.fix: Remove --reduce-by from worklog-specific options or clarify it's ONLY for delete-worklog (when used with adjust=manual)

findings.issue: The update-worklog command's --adjust-estimate option only supports [auto|leave|new], NOT 'manual'
findings.impact: Documentation for adjust-estimate is inconsistent across commands. Log and delete support 'manual', but update-worklog does not
findings.fix: Clarify in documentation that --adjust-estimate modes vary by command: log/delete support manual, update-worklog does not

findings.issue: Example uses single quotes around comment while other examples use double quotes. Inconsistent quoting style
findings.fix: Update to use double quotes: jira-as time bulk-log -i PROJ-1,PROJ-2 -t 15m -c "Sprint planning" -n

findings.issue: Documentation uses -o as shorthand for output in examples, but estimate command help shows only '--output' (no short form). Verify if tracking supports -o
findings.impact: Potential confusion about which form to use
findings.fix: Verify and confirm tracking command supports -o shorthand (it does)

findings.actual: Syntax is correct, but -f flag is for --force
findings.issue: The -f flag in bulk-log means --force (skip confirmation), but other commands use -f for --format. This is context-dependent and could confuse users
findings.impact: Potential confusion about what -f means in different contexts
findings.fix: Add a note in Common Options clarifying that -f has different meanings: bulk-log = force, report/export = format

critical_issues: Filter options missing from options table

priority_fixes.issue: Line 155 example will fail at runtime
priority_fixes.fix: Remove or replace the --reduce-by example; log command does not support this option

priority_fixes.issue: Options table incomplete for worklogs command
priority_fixes.fix: Add filter options (-s/--since, -u/--until, -a/--author) to worklogs row

priority_fixes.issue: Documentation claims --reduce-by works with log command
priority_fixes.fix: Clarify that --reduce-by is only for delete-worklog, not for log command
Standardize on short-form flags (e.g., -a instead of --author, -s instead of --since)

adjust-estimate_modes.documentation_note: Documentation does not clearly distinguish that update-worklog does NOT support manual mode

output_format_support.documentation_note: Common Options table incorrectly states all commands support same formats
